result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 8:40 AM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Frederick Jay Rothstein appeared by video, in custody at Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Frederick Jay Rothstein. Counsel advises no objection to findings of competency report. State advises in agreement.
doc for review to clerk RF
for Restitution for Blood Draw Expense filed by State - doc for review to Clerk RF

10:22 AM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Frederick Jay Rothstein appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Frederick Jay Rothstein. Counsel raises competency. Court orders competency eval.
Competency hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Competency hearing on June 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Absolute sobriety. No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Submit to SCRAM by 4:30 pm day of release. No contact with BAC.

1:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Frederick Jay Rothstein appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Frederick Jay Rothstein. Counsel waives reading. Defendant qualifies for PD. Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $5000 cash bail w/conditions. Counsel requests signature bond. Counsel waives time limits and requests status.
Status hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
